---

Reviewed 26 of 35 files at r1, 11 of 13 files at r2, 4 of 4 files at r4.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved, some commit checks broke.

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 48 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEFivQU-vSll-OLmQfi:-LEFivQU-vSll-OLmQfj:b-5xso3d) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4effd6bed0d9d6711e637e8bbea225df55f4872f/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L48)):*
> ```cpp
> constexpr size_t kLengthPrefixSize = 2;
> 
> typedef struct call_data {
> ```

Consider using the C++ filter API, defined in src/cpp/common/channel_filter.h.

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 67 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEFnijC8G1wO6mxRigg:-LEFnijC8G1wO6mxRigh:b-jui0um) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4effd6bed0d9d6711e637e8bbea225df55f4872f/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L67)):*
> ```cpp
>   // The closure that wraps the original closure. Scheduled when
>   // recv_initial_metadata is ready.
>   grpc_closure wrapped_recv_initial_metadata_ready;
> ```

Suggest removing the `wrapped_` prefix, both here and for the function below.

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 70 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEFjRZ4DOI8Hd4qyd5y:-LEFjRZ4DOI8Hd4qyd5z:b-ox2pjm) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4effd6bed0d9d6711e637e8bbea225df55f4872f/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L70)):*
> ```cpp
> 
>   // Corresponds to the :path header.
>   // TODO(bdrutu): Can we use the grpc_call_element_args::path?
> ```

No, you can't use that on the server side.  That field is only set on the client side.  The server side doesn't know the path at call construction time; it only knows it when it gets the recv_initial_metadata op.

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 90 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEFjw5D6yRkHHwzUlvM:-LEFjw5D6yRkHHwzUlvN:b7nx3yn) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4effd6bed0d9d6711e637e8bbea225df55f4872f/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L90)):*
> ```cpp
>   // because the data needed for recording the start comes from the initial
>   // metadata, which may not be ready before the call finishes.
>   bool was_start_recorded;
> ```

Shouldn't this be renamed to something like `seen_recv_initial_metadata`?

Can we tell this by checking that one of the fields above (e.g., original_recv_initial_metadata_ready) is non-null, rather than having a separate bool for it?

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 105 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEFlH-m9J2K4P3st4Vb:-LEFlH-m9J2K4P3st4Vc:b-7jj7s7) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4effd6bed0d9d6711e637e8bbea225df55f4872f/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L105)):*
> ```cpp
>                                       char** client_ip_string, size_t* size) {
>   // Find the client URI string.
>   auto client_uri_str =
> ```

Please use `const char*` instead of `auto` here.

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 198 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEFn1QvE3AWP5ZbopnV:-LEFn1QvE3AWP5ZbopnW:b-xz69di) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4effd6bed0d9d6711e637e8bbea225df55f4872f/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L198)):*
> ```cpp
>   } else if (calld->target_host == nullptr &&
>              grpc_slice_eq(GRPC_MDKEY(md), GRPC_MDSTR_AUTHORITY)) {
>     // TODO(juanlishen): The internal comment says the target host is constant
> ```

The host can be different per call if virtual hosting is in use.  Most people don't do that with grpc, though.

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 245 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEFntHxDrdGLQm3UZhw:-LEFntHxDrdGLQm3UZhx:b-3c27mp) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4effd6bed0d9d6711e637e8bbea225df55f4872f/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L245)):*
> ```cpp
>     calld->was_start_recorded = true;
>   }
>   // TODO(juanlishen): Ask yashkt; use RUN instead.
> ```

It's safe to use RUN here, since this is the end of a closure, and we can be sure no locks are being held.

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 259 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEFoAFjBlRiHLjDqOyx:-LEFoAFjBlRiHLjDqOyy:b9v4hv1) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4effd6bed0d9d6711e637e8bbea225df55f4872f/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L259)):*
> ```cpp
>                            const grpc_call_element_args* args) {
>   call_data* calld = reinterpret_cast<call_data*>(elem->call_data);
>   memset(calld, 0, sizeof(call_data));
> ```

No need for this memset().  Filter memory is always initialized to zero for you by the channel stack.

---

Previously, AspirinSJL (Juanli Shen) wrote…
Done. My IDE keeps telling me to use `auto` after casting. Any reason we don't want to use `auto` here?
The style guide says to only use `auto` when it helps readability, which I guess is a bit of a judgement call: https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#auto I personally prefer to make const-ness and pointer/reference types explicit in conjunction with `auto` (e.g., use `auto*` or `auto&` for pointers/references and `const auto` when it's const). And in this case, doing that would defeat the purpose, because `const auto*` is no shorter than `const char*`. --- *[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 93 at r6](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEuVUUYD95mqgdmd29V:-LEuVUUYD95mqgdmd29W:big5rjo) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/18ae670c729751712f809be3c1cdd3d007bc1699/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L93)):* > ```cpp > > private: > typedef struct cost_entry { > ``` Please use C++ style here: no need for the `typedef`, and the name should be `CostEntry`. --- *[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc, line 95 at r6](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEuVcZA64GFHT8VDWj-:-LEuVcZB9x7rIKhxzAfI:b4r8v7f) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/18ae670c729751712f809be3c1cdd3d007bc1699/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.cc#L95)):* > ```cpp > typedef struct cost_entry { > double cost; > const char cost_name_start[]; > ``` Seems weird to have a struct element declared as an array with no size. Maybe make this a pointer instead? --- *[src/cpp/common/channel_filter.h, line 210 at r6](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEuXn-E5okHjIAp0r-2:-LEuXn-E5okHjIAp0r-3:b-1nrbg2) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/18ae670c729751712f809be3c1cdd3d007bc1699/src/cpp/common/channel_filter.h#L210)):* > ```objc > } > > const gpr_atm* get_peer_string() const { > ``` This doesn't seem like quite the right API, because the peer string is handled as part of the send_initial_metadata op on the client side and part of the recv_initial_metadata op on the server side. I have removed the whole struct. --- *[src/cpp/common/channel_filter.h, line 210 at r6](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-LEuXn-E5okHjIAp0r-2:-LFKZK7F-ptCYDkTIbCx:bdd5olh) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/18ae670c729751712f809be3c1cdd3d007bc1699/src/cpp/common/channel_filter.h#L210)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
This doesn't seem like quite the right API, because the peer string is handled as part of the send_initial_metadata op on the client side and part of the recv_initial_metadata op on the server side. So I think we need to either make different methods for the two or else have this method check both to see which one is non-null.
Done. I had this method check both. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15570#-:-LFKZe3m1B-MzSxMKQKB:b-lu5w2g)*
